div1.p: Caldwell dispenses gossip about Drs. Gorgas, Brem, and Beverly. Carter supplies additional information.

div1.head: Letter fragment from Bert W. Caldwell to [Henry Rose Carter, 1911] [Enclosed in C0127001]
div1.opener:
Doctor Gorgas has returned and is looking very well. He seems to be in better
health and spirits than usual. Every one is more than pleased that he is back again. His
presence here gives a feeling of security to the Canal employes that is wonderful. Doct-
or Brem has resigned as Chief of Clinic at Colon Hospital and our old friend Doctor
Beverly has been nominated for the vacancy. It is an excellent selection, for what Beverly
may lack in theory as compared to Brem, he more thna makes up in practice. Brem was pro-
REPUBLICA DE PANAMA
HOSPITAL SANTO TOMAS
OFICINA DEL SUPERINTENDENTE
Número
PANAMA,
div1.p:
the best informed medical men in the entire Corps of physicians and by the same token
was probably the worst therapeutist. I hope that Doctor Beverly lands the place, which
he will, no doubt, unless the Chairman abolishes it altogether.

You will pardon the gossipy part of this letter, but I know you are interested.
I see Henry quite frequently. He is making an excellent reputation in Ancon. Incident-
ally he is paying decided attention to one of the sweetest faced young ladies in
Ancon. She is decidedly pretty and delightful.

I hope Mrs. Carter and yourself are not suffering from the warm weather
and that you are both in good health. Will you kindly remember me to Mrs. Carter and
Miss Laura.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, B.W. Caldwell Ancon C.Z.
Brem accepts the chair of Experi-
mental Medicine & Clinical Micros-
copy at same Med. School at Los An-
geles Cal. so Henry writes Leiler
goes with him as asst.
H.R.C
